definition:
The Lemoine point of a triangle, is the intersection point of its three
symmedians. (That is, the isogonal conjugate of the centroid).

It is related with the Gergonne point by the following result:\
On any triangle $ABC$, the Lemoine point of its Gergonne triangle is the
Gergonne point of $ABC$.

![image](lemoinep)

In the picture, the blue lines are the medians, intersecting an the
centroid $G$. The green lines are anglee bisectors intersecting at the
incentre $I$ and the red lines are symmedians. The symmedians intersect
at Lemoine point $L$.
